metadata.data_source: Web research aggregation - manufacturer specs, distributor pricing, trade publications
metadata.notes: All compliance data reflects 2026 regulatory environment. Prices are wholesale estimates and fluctuate. FEOC = Foreign Entity of Concern (China, Russia, NK, Iran ownership/control). AD/CVD tariffs on SE Asian crystalline silicon panels took effect 2024-2025.

regulatory_context.tpo_commercial_itc: TPO (lease/PPA) providers claim 48E commercial ITC - requires FEOC compliance
regulatory_context.domestic_content_bonus: 10% ITC adder for 50%+ US content threshold in 2026
regulatory_context.feoc_threshold_2026: 40% of manufactured products must not be from prohibited foreign entity (PFE) - increases 5% annually to 60% by 2029
regulatory_context.feoc_battery_threshold_2026: 55% of manufactured battery products must not be from PFE - increases to 75% by 2029

panels.manufacturing_notes: 8.4 GW total US capacity across Dalton and Cartersville, GA. Cartersville facility (2026) is first fully integrated US solar complex: ingots, wafers, cells, and modules under one roof. Polysilicon sourced from South Korea.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: Manufactured in USA - no AD/CVD or Section 201 tariffs apply
panels.feoc_notes: Hanwha is South Korean parent company. No Chinese/Russian/NK/Iran ownership or control.
panels.domestic_content_notes: Cartersville facility achieves high domestic content with US-made ingots, wafers, cells, and modules. Dalton modules use imported cells but still qualifies for partial domestic content.
panels.price_notes: Premium US-made pricing. Q1 2026 estimate for Dalton-assembled modules. Cartersville integrated modules may command slight premium.
panels.availability_notes: Largest US module manufacturer. ~45,000 panels/day by 2026. Strong distribution network.

panels.manufacturing_notes: Same Dalton facility. Most commonly available residential wattage class.
panels.feoc_notes: South Korean parent (Hanwha Group). Clean FEOC status.
panels.domestic_content_notes: Qualifies when paired with Cartersville-sourced cells. Module assembly in Dalton provides partial qualification.
panels.price_notes: Standard residential model pricing. High volume availability drives competitive pricing among US-made panels.
panels.availability_notes: Top-selling US residential panel. Available through all major distributors.

panels.manufacturing_location: Ohio, USA (multiple factories) + Louisiana factory (3.5 GW, opened 2025)
panels.manufacturing_notes: First Solar operates 5 US factories: 3 in Ohio, 1 in Alabama, 1 in Louisiana. Lake Township, OH newest factory (2026). Total US capacity exceeding 14 GW. Only major US thin-film manufacturer. CdTe technology uses no crystalline silicon - entirely different supply chain from Chinese competitors.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: 100% US manufactured. CdTe technology not subject to crystalline silicon AD/CVD tariffs. No SE Asian supply chain.
panels.feoc_notes: US-headquartered (Tempe, AZ). No foreign entity of concern involvement in ownership or manufacturing.
panels.domestic_content_notes: Strongest domestic content claim of any US panel. Fully vertically integrated US manufacturing from raw materials to finished module. Meets Buy America, Buy American requirements.
panels.price_notes: Primarily sold to utility and commercial segments via long-term contracts. Limited residential availability. Pricing reflects contract volumes.
panels.availability_notes: Primarily utility-scale. Large format panel not ideal for typical residential roofs. Some commercial distributors carry. Fully contracted through 2026+.

panels.manufacturing_notes: Best-performing Series 7 variant. AI-powered Louisiana factory represents most advanced manufacturing.
panels.feoc_notes: US company, US manufacturing, US supply chain
panels.domestic_content_notes: Maximum domestic content qualification. BABA (Build America Buy America) compliant.
panels.price_notes: Premium for highest efficiency CdTe class
panels.availability_notes: Contracted for utility projects. Residential availability very limited.

panels.manufacturing_location: Fort Mill, SC, USA (also Burlington, WA and Mississauga, ON, Canada)
panels.manufacturing_notes: Fort Mill facility includes first fully automated, integrated solar cell AND module manufacturing in the US. $100M investment for cell manufacturing. Also operates Washington state facility.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: Manufactured in USA (Fort Mill, SC). Canadian-headquartered but US manufacturing.
panels.feoc_notes: Canadian company. No Chinese/FEOC entity ownership or control.
panels.domestic_content_notes: Fort Mill cell + module integration provides strong domestic content claim. Cell manufacturing in SC enables higher domestic content percentage.
panels.price_notes: Premium pricing for highest-efficiency US-made panel. Elite series commands top-tier pricing.
panels.availability_notes: Strong residential distribution. Named Top 5 panel manufacturer in 2025. Growing production capacity.

panels.manufacturing_notes: Next-gen TOPCon technology line. N-type cells manufactured or sourced for Fort Mill assembly.
panels.feoc_notes: Canadian parent company. Clean supply chain.
panels.domestic_content_notes: US assembly with growing domestic cell sourcing capability from Fort Mill cell line.
panels.price_notes: Competitive with QCells equivalent. TOPCon technology at US-made pricing.
panels.availability_notes: Growing availability through 2026 as Fort Mill production ramps up.

panels.manufacturing_notes: 300 MW module capacity at San Antonio facility. 800,000+ modules deployed. Expanding to 1 GW cell production by Q1 2026, with plans for 2 GW total cell capacity via 200,000 sq ft expansion.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: 100% USA designed, engineered, and assembled in San Antonio, TX
panels.feoc_notes: US-headquartered and operated. No FEOC involvement.
panels.domestic_content_notes: Strong Texas-based manufacturing. Cell production expansion improves domestic content percentage significantly.
panels.price_notes: Competitive pricing for US-made. San Antonio location means no state income tax overhead. Good value proposition for Texas installers.
panels.availability_notes: Strong Texas/Southwest distribution. Capacity expanding rapidly in 2026.

panels.manufacturing_location: Rogers, MN, USA (also Mountain Iron, MN)
panels.manufacturing_notes: 1.3 GW total US capacity across Minnesota facilities. Rogers facility opened April 2025 adding 500 MW. Partnered with Suniva (US cells) and Corning (US glass). Achieving 66% domestic content. Steel frames from Origami (US-made) available alongside aluminum options. Planning 1 GW cell facility with Premier Energies by Q2 2026.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: Assembled in USA (Minnesota). Canadian-headquartered with US manufacturing.
panels.feoc_notes: Canadian parent company. Suniva (US) cell partnership. No FEOC entities in supply chain.
panels.domestic_content_notes: 66% domestic content achieved through US-sourced cells (Suniva), glass (Corning), and steel frames (Origami). Among highest domestic content percentages available.
panels.price_notes: Competitive US-made pricing. Domestic content premium justified by ITC adder qualification.
panels.availability_notes: Growing capacity. 220+ new employees at Rogers facility. Strong Midwest distribution.

panels.manufacturing_notes: 2 GW nameplate capacity at Goodyear facility. Shipping 600 MW/year from January 2026. Swiss-headquartered company with proprietary HJT cell technology. SWCT (SmartWire Connection Technology) is unique differentiator.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: Manufactured in USA (Goodyear, AZ). Swiss parent company.
panels.domestic_content_notes: US module assembly. Cell technology uses proprietary Swiss/German equipment. Domestic content percentage improving with Arizona production ramp.
panels.price_notes: Premium pricing reflects advanced HJT technology and Swiss engineering. Higher $/W but superior temperature coefficient and low degradation offset cost.
panels.availability_notes: 600 MW annual commitment from Goodyear. Available through specialty distributors. Growing US presence.

panels.manufacturing_notes: REC is Norwegian-founded, now Indian-owned (Reliance Industries). Manufacturing in Singapore. No Chinese manufacturing. Singapore factory suffered fire in June 2025 but deliveries back on track by August 2025.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: Manufactured in Singapore - not subject to SE Asian AD/CVD tariffs (those target Cambodia, Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia). Singapore is exempt.
panels.feoc_notes: Indian parent company (Reliance Industries). Norwegian heritage. No Chinese/FEOC ownership. Attractive for 2026 FEOC compliance.
panels.domestic_content_notes: Manufactured in Singapore. Does not qualify for domestic content bonus.
panels.price_notes: Competitive import pricing. No AD/CVD tariffs from Singapore. Section 201 tariff applies but at lower rate. Strong value for non-domestic-content projects.
panels.availability_notes: Next shipment to US scheduled February 2026. Post-fire production recovery complete. Lead-free (RoHS compliant).

panels.cell_config: IBC cells with solid copper backing
panels.manufacturing_notes: Spun off from SunPower in 2020. Manufacturing in Mexico. Solid copper cell backing (no thin ribbons) provides unique durability. Backed by TCL (36.5%) and TotalEnergies (24.4%). Note: TCL is a Chinese entity - may affect FEOC status for ITC claims.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: Mexico subject to 25% tariff as of Feb 2026 (Trump tariff). Also facing CBP detentions under UFLPA despite 8,000+ compliant prior shipments. Tariff situation volatile.
panels.feoc_notes: TCL (Chinese company) holds 36.5% ownership stake. This likely makes Maxeon a FEOC-controlled entity under 2026 rules. Projects claiming 48E ITC should verify carefully.
panels.domestic_content_notes: Manufactured in Mexico. No US domestic content.
panels.price_notes: Premium panel pricing plus tariff uncertainty. UFLPA detention risk adds supply uncertainty. Price may include 25% Mexico tariff.
panels.availability_notes: CBP detention of Mexico-shipped panels ongoing. Supply unreliable for 2026. Available through SunPower legacy dealers when not detained. 40-year warranty is industry longest.

panels.manufacturing_location: Jacksonville, FL, USA (module assembly) / Cells from Malaysia, SE Asia
panels.manufacturing_notes: Jacksonville factory is 400 MW capacity, third-largest US module factory. Highly automated. However, cells still sourced from SE Asian facilities. US operations raided by federal agents in 2023 for AD/CVD circumvention investigation. Malaysian cell operations face 19.82% AD/CVD rate.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: Module assembly in USA but cells from Malaysia face 19.82% AD/CVD tariff. Jacksonville modules using imported cells may face circumvention risk. Chinese parent company adds complexity.
panels.feoc_notes: JinkoSolar is Chinese-headquartered (Shanghai). Parent company is a Chinese entity, likely classified as FEOC. Projects claiming 48E ITC should not use Jinko panels.
panels.domestic_content_notes: Module assembly only in Jacksonville - cells imported. Does not meet 50% domestic content threshold for ITC adder.
panels.price_notes: Lowest-cost option among panels with any US manufacturing. Price advantage significant for cash-deal or markets without ITC (e.g., San Antonio municipal utility). May include AD/CVD costs on cell imports.
panels.availability_notes: Available but FEOC and tariff risks make it unsuitable for ITC-dependent projects. Good option for markets without credits (San Antonio CPS Energy territory).

panels.manufacturing_notes: Canadian Solar restructured US-facing operations under Canadian parent to avoid FEOC classification. Series 7 modules primarily produced in China. No confirmed US factory. Mesquite, TX facility is distribution/warehouse only.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: Manufactured in China and SE Asia. Subject to Section 301 tariffs (China) and AD/CVD tariffs (SE Asia). Thailand factory faces 91.44%+ tariff rates.
panels.feoc_notes: Despite Canadian restructuring, manufacturing subsidiaries (CSI Solar) are Chinese-controlled. FEOC status problematic for 48E ITC claims. Ownership restructuring may help but untested under final Treasury rules.
panels.domestic_content_notes: No US manufacturing. Does not qualify.
panels.price_notes: Very low base price but massive tariff exposure. Effective landed cost with tariffs could be $0.50-0.80+/W depending on country of origin. Primarily utility-scale format.
panels.availability_notes: Large format for utility/commercial. Tariff exposure makes US pricing uncompetitive vs domestic alternatives. Supply chain restructuring ongoing.

panels.manufacturing_notes: LONGi's Vina Solar subsidiary found to be circumventing US tariffs by DOC in 2024. Company reducing SE Asian production. No US manufacturing. Adjusting production to serve India and Canada markets instead of US.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: Vietnamese factory faces 800%+ AD/CVD tariffs. Chinese production subject to Section 301 tariffs. DOC circumvention finding makes all LONGi imports high-risk.
panels.feoc_notes: Chinese-headquartered company. Definitive FEOC entity. Cannot be used for 48E ITC projects.
panels.price_notes: Among lowest global module prices but effectively unavailable in US at reasonable cost due to tariffs. Global wholesale $0.08-0.10/W; US landed with tariffs potentially $0.80+/W.
panels.availability_notes: Tariffs and circumvention findings make LONGi panels impractical for US market in 2026. Used extensively globally but US market access blocked.

panels.manufacturing_notes: Chinese-headquartered. Thailand factory faces 375.19% AD/CVD duty. Vietnam operations face 800%+ tariffs. No US manufacturing. Has expanded wafer capacity outside China but still heavily tariffed.
panels.tariff_safe_reason: Thailand production faces 375%+ tariff. Vietnam 800%+. Chinese production faces Section 301 tariffs. All routes to US are heavily tariffed.
panels.feoc_notes: Chinese-headquartered company. FEOC entity. Cannot be used for 48E ITC projects.
panels.price_notes: Very cheap globally but US landed cost prohibitive. Global wholesale near $0.10/W but tariffs add $0.30-3.00+/W depending on origin.
panels.availability_notes: Massive tariff exposure makes Trina panels uneconomic for US market. Global #1 shipper but US share collapsing.

inverters.manufacturing_location: South Carolina + Texas, USA (contract manufacturing with Flex, Salcomp)
inverters.manufacturing_notes: Enphase shifted manufacturing from China to US contract manufacturers. IQ8 series assembled in South Carolina and Texas. BABA (Build America Buy America) compliant SKUs available (IQ8HC-72-M-DOM-US). 55nm chip technology.
inverters.feoc_notes: US-headquartered (Fremont, CA). US-manufactured SKUs available. FEOC compliance tool available - enter serial number to verify. PCBA and enclosure verified non-FEOC.
inverters.domestic_content_notes: US-manufactured DOM-US SKUs qualify for domestic content. BABA compliant.
inverters.price_notes: Estimated $140-170 per unit wholesale depending on volume. Retail ~$200-240. Premium over string inverters justified by panel-level optimization and safety.
inverters.grid_forming_notes: Industry's first microgrid-forming microinverter. Split-phase power conversion. Can provide backup power with IQ Battery.
inverters.availability_notes: Dominant US residential microinverter. Massive distribution network. IQ9 commercial microinverters shipping January 2026.

inverters.manufacturing_notes: Highest-power IQ8 variant. Designed for 400W+ panels. US-manufactured DOM-US SKUs available.
inverters.feoc_notes: Same FEOC-compliant manufacturing as IQ8+. DOM-US SKUs verified clean.
inverters.domestic_content_notes: DOM-US SKUs qualify for domestic content bonus.
inverters.price_notes: Slight premium over IQ8+ for higher power handling. ~$160-180 wholesale.
inverters.grid_forming_notes: Grid-forming capable. Best paired with 400W+ panels like QCells Q.TRON or Silfab Elite.
inverters.availability_notes: Standard choice for modern high-wattage residential panels.

inverters.manufacturing_notes: Austin facility reached 50,000 unit quarterly run rate by Q2 2024. Single-SKU design consolidates all power classes into one part number. Backup-ready. Commercial inverter production from Florida starting 2026. Also shipping US-made inverters to Europe (Italy, France, Netherlands).
inverters.feoc_notes: Israeli-headquartered company. US manufacturing in Austin, TX. No FEOC entity involvement.
inverters.domestic_content_notes: US-manufactured in Austin, TX. Qualifies for domestic content.
inverters.price_notes: Estimated $1,800-2,500 wholesale for 10kW class. Requires power optimizers ($30-50 each) adding ~$800-1,200 for typical system.
inverters.grid_forming_notes: Backup-ready with SolarEdge Home Battery. Not standalone grid-forming.
inverters.rapid_shutdown_notes: Power optimizers provide NEC 690.12 module-level rapid shutdown compliance
inverters.availability_notes: Major residential inverter brand. Austin production ramped. SolarEdge ONE energy management system integration.

inverters.manufacturing_location: Fremont, CA / Sparks, NV, USA (Tesla Gigafactory)
inverters.manufacturing_notes: Integrated into Powerwall 3 - not sold separately. Eliminates need for separate solar inverter. 6 MPPT channels support up to 20kW DC solar. Tesla controls entire design and assembly.
inverters.feoc_notes: Tesla is US-headquartered. Inverter hardware manufactured in US. Battery cell FEOC status is separate concern (CATL cells - see battery section).
inverters.domestic_content_notes: US-designed and assembled. Strong domestic content claim for inverter portion.
inverters.price_notes: Not sold separately. Included in Powerwall 3 system price ($11,500 for first unit). Inverter value estimated at ~$2,000-3,000 of system cost.
inverters.grid_forming_notes: Full home backup capable. 185 LRA motor starting. Storm Watch auto-charging.
inverters.availability_notes: Bundled with Powerwall 3 only. Requires Tesla Certified Installer. Cannot be purchased standalone.

inverters.manufacturing_notes: Generac is US-headquartered in Waukesha, WI with multiple Wisconsin manufacturing facilities (Berlin, Oshkosh, Jefferson, Eagle, Whitewater). New Sussex, WI facility expanding manufacturing footprint. Also available as 7.6kW single-phase model.
inverters.feoc_notes: US-headquartered and US-manufactured. No FEOC entity involvement.
inverters.price_notes: 7.6kW model: $3,200-$4,000. 11.4kW model: $4,800-$5,500. Does not include battery cabinet or modules.
inverters.grid_forming_notes: Full backup capability with PWRcell battery system. 11kW surge capacity in backup mode.
inverters.availability_notes: Strong distribution through Generac dealer network. Well-known generator brand with growing solar presence.

inverters.manufacturing_notes: German-headquartered. Sunny Boy line manufactured in China. Sunny Tripower made in Germany. Hybrid model supports battery integration. Available in 3.8, 5.8, 7.7, 9.6 kW sizes.
inverters.feoc_notes: German-headquartered company. China manufacturing but no FEOC entity ownership. SMA AG is publicly traded on Frankfurt exchange.
inverters.domestic_content_notes: Manufactured in China/Germany. No US production.
inverters.price_notes: Estimated $1,500-2,500 depending on model size. Premium European engineering. 10-year warranty standard with registration.
inverters.warranty_notes: 5-year factory warranty, extends to 10 years with registration within 12 months. Optional 15, 20, or 25-year extended warranties available.
inverters.grid_forming_notes: Backup capability with compatible battery. Not standalone grid-forming.
inverters.availability_notes: Established brand with strong installer following. Low failure rates.

inverters.manufacturing_notes: Austrian-headquartered and manufactured. Premium European build quality. Active cooling system. PV Point feature provides basic backup without battery. Available in 3.8-10.0 kW range.
inverters.feoc_notes: Austrian company. No FEOC entity involvement.
inverters.domestic_content_notes: Manufactured in Austria. No US production.
inverters.price_notes: Premium pricing for Austrian quality. $2,000-2,800 wholesale depending on size. Extended warranty available up to 20 years.
inverters.warranty_notes: 2-year standard, extends to 10 years free with registration. Extendable to 20 years for fee.
inverters.grid_forming_notes: PV Point provides emergency solar power without battery. Full backup with compatible battery storage (BYD HVS/HVM compatible).
inverters.availability_notes: Well-distributed in US market. Known for low failure rates and fast warranty service (3-5 day replacement shipping).

inverters.manufacturing_notes: Chinese-headquartered (Jiaxing). Dual-module design - one microinverter handles two panels. Replaces discontinued QS1 (quad module). Encrypted wireless Zigbee communication.
inverters.feoc_notes: Chinese-headquartered and manufactured. FEOC entity. Not suitable for projects claiming 48E ITC.
inverters.domestic_content_notes: Manufactured in China. No US production.
inverters.price_notes: MSRP ~$246. Wholesale ~$180-220. Cost-effective on per-panel basis since one unit serves two panels (~$100/panel).
inverters.grid_forming_notes: Grid-tied only. No backup or grid-forming capability.
inverters.availability_notes: Budget alternative to Enphase. Good for cash-deal systems where FEOC/ITC compliance not needed. Backward compatible with QS1 and YC600 accessories.

inverters.manufacturing_notes: American-designed and assembled. EMP-hardened. All-in-one: grid-tie, off-grid, and battery backup. Also available as 12K model. 30K and 60K commercial models available.
inverters.feoc_notes: US company, US assembly. Actively publishing FEOC compliance guidance for commercial energy storage projects.
inverters.domestic_content_notes: US-assembled. Check specific component sourcing for full domestic content qualification.
inverters.price_notes: Estimated $4,500-5,500 wholesale. Premium for all-in-one capability and EMP hardening. Compatible with many battery brands.
inverters.grid_forming_notes: Full off-grid capable. Grid-tie, off-grid, and battery backup in one unit. UL1741SA/SB compliant.
inverters.availability_notes: Growing installer adoption. Popular for off-grid and resilience-focused installations. Compatible with multiple battery brands.

batteries.inverter_notes: Built-in solar inverter (up to 20kW DC input). Eliminates need for separate inverter. 6 MPPT channels.
batteries.manufacturing_location: Fremont, CA / Sparks, NV, USA (assembly). Battery cells from CATL (China).
batteries.manufacturing_notes: Tesla assembles in US but LFP cells are CATL-manufactured in China. Tesla planning LFP cell manufacturing at Sparks, NV Gigafactory but not yet online. CATL investing $200M in US assembly plant (TX or SE US) for future localization. Pilot CATL-cell Megapacks expected Q4 2026.
batteries.feoc_notes: CATL is a Chinese company - definitively a FEOC entity. Battery cells from CATL make Powerwall 3 non-FEOC compliant for the battery component. This matters for commercial/TPO projects claiming 48E ITC with battery adder. Residential cash deals unaffected.
batteries.domestic_content_notes: US assembly but Chinese-sourced cells. Does not meet domestic content threshold for battery component.
batteries.price_notes: $11,500 for first unit, $7,000 for each additional unit (same installation). Installed cost typically $10,000-$12,000 per unit. Includes integrated inverter - no separate inverter cost.
batteries.availability_notes: Requires Tesla Certified Installer. Widely available. Integrated inverter simplifies installation. Storm Watch feature auto-charges before severe weather.

batteries.inverter_notes: Six embedded grid-forming microinverters. AC-coupled system.
batteries.manufacturing_notes: Enphase has verified certain battery products as FEOC-compliant through supply chain evaluation. AC-coupled design means battery works with any existing solar inverter. Serial number lookup tool available for FEOC verification.
batteries.feoc_notes: Enphase has FEOC compliance verification tool. Certain IQ Battery SKUs are verified FEOC compliant. US-headquartered with clean supply chain for verified products.
batteries.domestic_content_notes: US-manufactured FEOC-compliant SKUs may qualify. Verify specific SKU.
batteries.price_notes: Approximately $7,500 per unit. Two-unit system (10 kWh) averages ~$15,000 installed. Modular design - add units as needed.
batteries.availability_notes: Pairs naturally with Enphase IQ8 microinverter systems. Modular 5 kWh increments. UL 9540A large-scale fire tested. LFP chemistry for safety.

batteries.inverter_notes: Twelve embedded microinverters. Thinner profile than 5P for space-constrained installations.
batteries.manufacturing_notes: Thinner form factor version of 10 kWh capacity. Same FEOC verification process as 5P.
batteries.feoc_notes: FEOC compliance verified via Enphase serial number tool.
batteries.domestic_content_notes: Verify specific SKU for domestic content qualification.
batteries.price_notes: Approximately $12,000 per unit. More cost-effective per kWh than two 5P units.
batteries.availability_notes: Thinner profile for tight installations. Same power output as 5P pair but single unit.

batteries.inverter_notes: Built-in advanced inverter. Works with aGate energy management hub. AC-coupled system.
batteries.manufacturing_location: USA (San Jose, CA headquarters). Cell sourcing details not publicly confirmed.
batteries.manufacturing_notes: US-headquartered in San Jose, CA. aPower 2 is next-gen model with 15 kWh (up from 13.6 kWh original aPower). Works with aGate for whole-home energy management. Multiple compliance certifications including UL 9540, UL 9540A, IEEE 1547, seismic AC156.
batteries.feoc_notes: FEOC compliance status not publicly confirmed by FranklinWH as of early 2026. Cell sourcing details would determine compliance. Contact manufacturer for current FEOC certification.
batteries.domestic_content_notes: Cell manufacturing location not confirmed as US. Assembly may be domestic but full domestic content unlikely without US cell sourcing.
batteries.price_notes: $10,000-$12,000 for battery unit. Full system with aGate ~$17,500 installed. Does not include installation labor.
batteries.availability_notes: Growing rapidly in residential market. Strong California presence. aGate hub required for system operation. Up to 15 units for 225 kWh total storage.

batteries.inverter_notes: Requires separate Generac PWRcell inverter (7.6kW or 11.4kW). DC-coupled system.
batteries.manufacturing_location: Waukesha, WI area, USA (Generac). Battery cells sourced from various suppliers.
batteries.manufacturing_notes: Generac is US-headquartered in Waukesha, WI. PWRcell 2 is modular: 9-18 kWh configurable capacity using 4.5 kWh battery modules. Inverter manufactured in Wisconsin. Cell sourcing not fully disclosed.
batteries.feoc_notes: Generac is US company but battery cell sourcing details not publicly confirmed for FEOC compliance. Inverter is US-made and clean. Battery module cell origin should be verified with Generac.
batteries.domestic_content_notes: Inverter is US-manufactured. Battery module domestic content depends on cell sourcing. System-level domestic content may qualify.
batteries.price_notes: $14,000-$25,000 for complete system (inverter + battery cabinet + modules). Inverter alone: $3,200-$5,500. Modular design allows right-sizing.
batteries.availability_notes: Strong dealer network (Generac is #1 US generator brand). PWRcell 2 is latest generation. Configurable 9-18 kWh capacity. NMC chemistry (higher energy density but less inherently safe than LFP).

batteries.inverter_notes: DC-coupled. Requires SolarEdge Home Hub Inverter and Backup Interface. Highest round-trip efficiency in class at 94.5%.
batteries.manufacturing_notes: SolarEdge began US manufacturing of home battery in 2024. DC-coupled design achieves highest efficiency. One of first residential batteries to pass UL9540A unit-level fire safety test for indoor installation. Israeli-headquartered, US-manufactured.
batteries.feoc_notes: Israeli-headquartered company. US-manufactured battery. No FEOC entity involvement in ownership.
batteries.domestic_content_notes: US-manufactured. Verify cell sourcing for full domestic content qualification.
batteries.price_notes: $7,000 per unit before installation. Very competitive pricing. Requires SolarEdge inverter ecosystem.
batteries.availability_notes: Must be paired with SolarEdge Home Hub inverter. Best-in-class 94.5% round-trip efficiency. UL9540A certified for indoor installation. Up to 3 units per inverter.

batteries.inverter_notes: Built-in inverter. Smart home integration with automated energy management.
batteries.manufacturing_location: Germany (Wildpoldsried). US assembly in Atlanta, GA.
batteries.manufacturing_notes: German-engineered. Subsidiary of Shell (Netherlands/UK). Available in 12-30 kWh configurations. Premium smart home integration with Crestron, Control4, Savant. Atlanta assembly for US market.
batteries.feoc_notes: Shell subsidiary (Netherlands/UK). German engineering and manufacturing. No FEOC entity involvement.
batteries.domestic_content_notes: German-manufactured cells and electronics. US assembly only. Does not meet domestic content threshold.
batteries.price_notes: $36,000+ for 12 kWh model before installation. Premium luxury product. Significantly more expensive than competitors. Targeting high-end market.
batteries.availability_notes: Ultra-premium product. 15-year/15,000 cycle warranty is industry best. Smart home integration (Crestron, Control4, Savant). Lower round-trip efficiency (81.6%) is notable weakness. Best for luxury homes with smart home systems.

batteries.inverter_notes: Available in AC-coupled (89% efficiency) and DC-coupled (94% efficiency) configurations.
batteries.manufacturing_notes: CRITICAL: Panasonic announced discontinuation of solar and battery storage offerings on April 28, 2025. Committed to honoring warranties for existing customers and installations in progress. No new production for US market.
batteries.feoc_notes: Japanese company. No FEOC entity involvement. But product is DISCONTINUED.
batteries.domestic_content_notes: Product discontinued. N/A for new installations.
batteries.price_notes: $14,000-$18,000 installed for 13.5 kWh system. $1,300-$1,800/kWh installed. Product discontinued - remaining inventory only.
batteries.availability_notes: DISCONTINUED as of April 2025. Remaining distributor inventory may be available but no new production. Panasonic committed to long-term warranty support. Available in 9, 13.5, and 18 kWh configurations. Do NOT specify for new installations.

optimizers.description: Module-level power optimizer for residential and commercial PV systems. Pairs with SolarEdge string inverters for MLPE (module-level power electronics) compliance.

specs.compatibility: SolarEdge Home Hub and commercial inverters

pricing.distributor_availability: Widely available through CED Greentech, BayWa r.e., Soligent

optimizers.search_text: solaredge p505 optimizer 505w 60v mlpe module-level power electronics residential commercial

optimizers.description: 2-in-1 commercial power optimizer handling two modules per unit. Reduces installation time and cost for commercial rooftop and ground-mount systems.

pricing.distributor_availability: Available through commercial solar distributors

optimizers.search_text: solaredge p960 2-in-1 commercial optimizer 960w dual input

optimizers.description: Flex MLPE module-level power electronics unit providing optimization, monitoring, and NEC 2020 rapid shutdown compliance. Compatible with any string inverter brand.

specs.compatibility: Universal  works with any string inverter (SMA, Fronius, Sol-Ark, etc.)

pricing.distributor_availability: Available through major solar distributors

optimizers.search_text: tigo ts4-a-2f flex mlpe optimizer 700w universal rapid shutdown nec 2020

optimizers.description: Optimization-only MLPE unit providing per-module maximum power point tracking. Pairs with Tigo CCA or TAP for monitoring. Compatible with any string inverter.

specs.compatibility: Universal  works with any string inverter

best_for_tpo_itc_2026.description: Optimal equipment for Third-Party Owned (lease/PPA) installations claiming 48E ITC in 2026. Must be FEOC-compliant.

best_for_domestic_content_bonus.description: Equipment qualifying for 10% ITC domestic content adder (50%+ US content). Worth pursuing for commercial/TPO projects.

best_for_cash_deals_no_itc.description: For residential cash purchases or markets without ITC (e.g., San Antonio CPS Energy territory where residential ITC is gone). FEOC and domestic content don't matter. Optimize for price.
best_for_cash_deals_no_itc.notes: In markets without ITC, cheap non-compliant panels are fine. Jinko Jacksonville panels offer best price/performance. Chinese panels (LONGi, Trina) still prohibitively expensive due to tariffs even without ITC consideration.

tariff_safe_sources.description: Countries/sources not subject to AD/CVD tariffs on crystalline silicon cells/modules

uncertain.mexico: 25% tariff as of Feb 2026 (may be delayed). UFLPA/CBP detentions ongoing for some manufacturers.
uncertain.canada: 25% tariff as of Feb 2026 (may be delayed). Silfab has Canadian manufacturing but also US facilities.
